citations.narrative:
There is one coati housed in a multi-tier enclosure. Each tier has a solid floor. The veterinarian provided a guidance
document for the care of the coati. The guidance indicates that a hanging bed or similar place to hide and rest should be
provided for the coati. There was no hanging bed nor additional bedding nor place to hide and rest in the enclosure for
the coati. Not having bedding or a soft place to rest is a source of discomfort for the coati. Handling of the coati should
be done in a manner that does not cause discomfort. Provide appropriate equipment as recommended by the
veterinarian for the well-being of the coati.
Correct by March 1, 2023

There are eight guinea pigs housed in the facility. There are flies and gnats flying around the enclosure for the guinea
pigs. The applicant stated that usually fly strips and a bug zapper light were used for pest control. At the time of
inspection, however, only the bug zapper light was being used. Flies and gnats can carry disease that can cause illness
and are a source of discomfort for the guinea pigs. The facility should maintain an effective pest control program to
eliminate the flies and gnats from the facility.
Correct by March 1, 2023.

There are three prairie dogs housed in an enclosure that has a wire floor. The floor is covered with a solid mat. The mat
is chewed in several places, exposing the wire below. Guidance from the veterinarian for the care of the prairie dogs
states that the animals should not be housed on a wire floor. The guidance further indicates that the wire flooring may
injure the animals. Primary enclosures that are not maintained in good repair may cause injury.
Repair or replace the mat or flooring to ensure the animals are not injured by a wire floor.
Correct By: March 1, 2023
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by April 23, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires on February 25, 2023.
End Section

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
There is one coati housed in a multi-tier enclosure.  Each tier has a solid floor.  The veterinarian provided a guidance 
document for the care of the coati. The guidance  indicates that a hanging bed or similar place to hide and rest should be 
provided for the coati.  There was no hanging bed nor additional bedding nor place to hide and rest in the enclosure for 
the coati.  Not having bedding or a soft place to rest is a source of discomfort for the coati.  Handling of the coati should 
be done in a manner that does not cause discomfort.  Provide appropriate equipment as recommended by the 
veterinarian for the well-being of the coati. 
 
Correct by March 1, 2023 
3.31(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
There are eight guinea pigs housed in the facility.  There are flies and gnats flying around the enclosure for the guinea 
pigs.  The applicant stated that usually fly strips and a bug zapper light were used for pest control.  At the time of 
inspection, however, only the bug zapper light was being used.  Flies and gnats can carry disease that can cause illness 
and are a source of discomfort for the guinea pigs. The facility should maintain an effective pest control program to

eliminate the flies and gnats from the facility. 
Correct by March 1, 2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
There are three prairie dogs housed in an enclosure that has a wire floor.  The floor is covered with a solid mat.  The mat 
is chewed in several places, exposing the wire below.  Guidance from the veterinarian for the care of the prairie dogs 
states that the animals should not be housed on a wire floor.  The guidance further indicates that the wire flooring may 
injure the animals.  Primary enclosures that are not maintained in good repair may cause injury. 
Repair or replace the mat or flooring to ensure the animals are not injured by a wire floor. 
 
Correct By: March 1, 2023 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class B license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by April 23, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires on February 25, 2023. 
 
End Section
